column4: Hey, when I try to make something, I get this error: "configure: error: Can't find X includes""
I assume I need to get the x develop package, but I don't know what package to get
apt-get build-dep for a similar X package should get all the X headers and other development requirements.
what would the command be? I don't understand you.
What are you trying to build?
Do you have any other kde themes already installed?
No, I just got KDE a few hours ago.
Try something like: apt-get build-dep kde-icons-crystal
using any kde theme package name.  That should get all the build requirements.
Well, I'm fetching xlibs-dev now... We'll see of that works
Well, now I need Qt, but of course can't figurew out the package name
You know about apt-cache search and aptitude search?
Yes, but they are aall like documentations and tools for developing.
Adding a "| grep dev" to the end of the search line is often appropriate when you're trying to find development headers.
Those qt and gtk packages do tend to proliferate, so anything like dev that you can give grep to make the list smaller can help in searching ...
I think I found the right package... libqt3-dev
